com.camerontec.catalys.util.fast.codec

Interface IDecimalField

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IField, IInstruction
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DecimalField, DecimalIndividualOperators

    public interface IDecimalField
extends IField
    Represents FAST decimalField element of template.

    A decimal can be expressed as two integer fields - for the mantissa and exponent.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IField getExponentField()
      Returns an int32 field specification for the exponent.
      IField getMantissaField()
      Returns an int32 field specification for the mantissa.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.camerontec.catalys.util.fast.codec.IField

        getDictionary, getDictionaryName, getDictionaryType, getInternalKey, getKey, getName, getOperator, getTemplateName, getType, getValue, isAssignedPresenceBit, isOptional, setTemplateName

    • Method Detail

      • getExponentField

        IField getExponentField()
        Returns an int32 field specification for the exponent.

        Should never return null. If a decimal does not have individual operators for exponent and mantissa, it should be defined using an IField object, like any other normal field.

        The field should be named according to the decimal name + something indicating exponent.

        Presence of the returned field is identical to presence of decimal field.

        Returns:
        field representing exponent part of decimal

      • getMantissaField

        IField getMantissaField()
        Returns an int32 field specification for the mantissa.

        Should never return null. If a decimal does not have individual operators for exponent and mantissa, it should be defined using an IField object, like any other normal field.

        The field should be named according to the decimal name + something indicating mantissa.

        The returned field should always have mandatory presence.

        Returns:
        field representing mantissa part of decimal
